title: 103_hr2263
content: The "Social Security Tax Fairness Act of 1993" is cited as the Act. It introduces a credit for a portion of employee OASDI taxes in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The "Social Security Tax Fairness Act of 1993" introduces a tax credit for a portion of employee OASDI taxes in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Individuals can claim a credit against their tax for the taxable year, limited to the lesser of their employee OASDI taxes or the tax credit limitation amount for the calendar year. The tax credit limitation amount is determined by the Secretary to balance revenues to the Federal Old-Age and Survivors Insurance Trust Fund. The tax credit limitation amount for Railroad retirement individuals is determined by the Railroad Retirement Board to offset the increase in revenues from applying certain taxes to compensation exceeding the contribution and benefit base. The Secretary of the Treasury and the Railroad Retirement Board adjust tax credit limitation amounts to maintain the stability of the Federal Old-Age and Survivors Insurance Trust Fund and the Railroad Retirement Account. Employee OASDI taxes refer to the taxes imposed on taxpayers for any taxable year. The tax credit limitation amounts are adjusted by the Secretary of the Treasury and the Railroad Retirement Board to support the stability of the Federal Old-Age and Survivors Insurance Trust Fund and the Railroad Retirement Account. Employee OASDI taxes are imposed on taxpayers for each taxable year, including taxes on self-employment income. The taxpayer receives amounts during the taxable year. Payments under agreements with foreign affiliates are treated as taxes. The contribution and benefit base is determined under the Social Security Act. The Secretary of the Treasury pays the cost of credit from the OASDI trust fund to the Treasury's general fund. The Insurance Trust Fund and Railroad Retirement Account transfer credits under section 35 of the Internal Revenue Code to the general fund of the Treasury based on estimates by the Secretary of the Treasury or the Railroad Retirement Board. The Railroad Retirement Board and Insurance Trust Fund transfer credits to the Treasury based on estimates, with adjustments made for any discrepancies. Technical amendments are made to section 1324(b) of title 31, United States Code, and the table of sections for subpart C of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 of the Code. The amendments made by this section apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 1993. Repeal of dollar limitation on amount of wages subject to employee OASDI tax. The OASDI Tax, Self-Employment Tax, and Railroad Retirement Tax are amended in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The changes apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 1993. The dollar limitation on wages subject to employee OASDI tax is repealed. The Railroad Retirement Tax in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to adjust employee OASDI taxes. The changes apply to taxable years after December 31, 1993, and repeal the dollar limitation on wages subject to employee OASDI tax. The Railroad Retirement Tax in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to adjust employee OASDI taxes for taxable years after December 31, 1993. The changes remove the dollar limitation on wages subject to employee OASDI tax by amending various sections of the Code. The amendments made by this section shall apply to 1994 and later calendar years.
